    • Method Detail

      • getMediaTypes

        public Set<String> getMediaTypes()
        Description copied from interface: WorkflowBundleReader
        Return the media types that this reader can read.

        Returned media types are must be valid mediaType arguments to WorkflowBundleReader.readBundle(File, String) and/or WorkflowBundleReader.readBundle(InputStream, String) for this reader.

        It is recommended, but not required, that the reader can also recognise those media types from WorkflowBundleReader.guessMediaTypeForSignature(byte[]).

        If the returned set is empty, the reader should should be able to Recognise at least one media type from WorkflowBundleReader.guessMediaTypeForSignature(byte[]).

        Specified by:
        getMediaTypes in interface WorkflowBundleReader
        Returns:
        the media types that this reader can read, or an empty set if this reader can't read any bundle formats.

      • readBundle

        public WorkflowBundle readBundle(File bundleFile,
                        String mediaType)
                          throws ReaderException,
                                 IOException
        Description copied from interface: WorkflowBundleReader
        Read a file containing a workflow bundle in the specified media type and return a WorkflowBundle.
        Specified by:
        readBundle in interface WorkflowBundleReader
        Parameters:
        bundleFile - the file containing the workflow bundle
        mediaType - the media type of the workflow bundle
        Returns:
        the WorkflowBundle read from the file
        Throws:
        ReaderException - if there is an error parsing the workflow bundle
        IOException - if there is an error reading the file

      • guessMediaTypeForSignature

        public String guessMediaTypeForSignature(byte[] firstBytes)
        Description copied from interface: WorkflowBundleReader
        Attempt to guess the media type for a stream or file that starts with these bytes.

        Return null if ambiguous (more than one possibility) or unknown.

        Typically a WorkflowBundleReader should be able to recognise the same types as those listed in WorkflowBundleReader.getMediaTypes(), but this is no requirement. A WorkflowBundleReader could also recognise types not listed in its WorkflowBundleReader.getMediaTypes().

        Specified by:
        guessMediaTypeForSignature in interface WorkflowBundleReader
        Parameters:
        firstBytes - The initial bytes, at least 512 bytes long unless the resource is smaller.
        Returns:
        The recognised media type, or null if the bytes were ambiguous or unknown.
